Dispute_Type: Civil dispute over copyright ownership and standing
Legal_Issue: Entitlement to 'costs thrown away' due to late amendments by defendant
Evidence_Assessment: Plaintiffs failed to prove copyright creation date, standing, and title
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to prove standing and ownership of copyright
Legal_Rule: Costs thrown away are awarded only if amendments render prior work useless
Procedural_Issue: Amendment of defense and its impact on incurred costs
Grounds_for_Claim: Defendant's late amendment regarding plaintiff's standing
Outcome_on_Merits: Case dismissed due to lack of evidence from plaintiffs
Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence (or lack thereof) on copyright creation date, standing, and title
Legal_Framework: Costs rules related to amendments in civil litigation
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought recovery of costs thrown away
Court_Result: Denied plaintiffs' claim for costs thrown away
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles on costs and amendments
Defendant_Response: Sought to amend defense regarding plaintiffs' standing
Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence on ownership and creation date
Outcome: Plaintiffs not entitled to costs thrown away
Remedy_Sought: Compensation for allegedly wasted legal costs
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to prove essential elements of claim
Applicable_Process: Civil litigation with post-trial costs application
Governing_Rule: Costs follow the event; costs thrown away require rendered work useless
